description:
Opportunity Knocks In Creswick
Here is an opportunity to snap up one of two residential allotments in a popular location of beautiful Creswick. Sitting side by side and predominantly popular for families who commute through to Ballarat, this flat vacant allotment should be considered for your next real estate project or construction of your dream home.
With all town services available and offering approximately 763m2 of level land, this allotment is fenced to one side and the back and is within walking distance to all the town amenities, along with a handy bus stop just over the road.
A short 15 minutes will take you through to Ballarat or to connect with the Western Freeway, while Creswick is also popular due to its proximity to Daylesford, Castlemaine or Bendigo.
A great opportunity for those looking for a lovely country atmosphere or investors with an opportunity here to construct a single build or townhouses (STCA) as an investment project. Call our agent for further details and full land measurements.

Fabulous Family Home
From the moment you walk through the door, you will know you are home. Thoughtful in design and layout this tastefully decorated spacious home on approx. two acres comprises 3 generous sized bedrooms all robes, and walk-in robe and water closet adjoin the master. Study/family room with feature double doors can easily be converted to a fourth bedroom for the extra family member. Stainless appliances complete the stylish and functional kitchen open to the living and dining areas.
Plenty of outdoor fun to be had in the partially inground pool with sloping deep end to 6plus own decking and solar heating. Sit in one of the numerous spots along the expansive deck to watch the sun set in the East behind Back Creek, the seasonal creek running along the property boundary.
Features Include:
Solaheart hot water
Evaporative cooling
Heat transfer from solid fuel heater
Outdoor pool approx. 5 x4m with solar heating
Large deck expanding length of house
Double carport with electric roller doors
4 car garage/workshop
Sundry shedding
Additional 3 acres leased from DELWP
On the north side of the property, there is an additional separate workshop with own power & water, formerly the Talbot Duck farm.
Talbot is located in the heart of the Golden Triangle, an area rich in a golden history and this attractive home is definitely a golden nugget!!

Quiet Country Retreat with all the comforts.
Upon entering the property, you instantly feel at home with the comfort of the slow burn wood heater and the striking Tasmanian Oak timber floors.
Internally the property consists of four oversized bedrooms, a study, and two bathrooms. The house also features a modern kitchen with a butler’s pantry and an open plan living-dining area.
The king-size master is a luxurious retreat with a fully renovated ensuite and walk-in-robe. The remaining three bedrooms are spacious and include built in robes. There is also a large study which could be a 5th bedroom if required.
The kitchen dining area is a real feature of this family home that is built to entertain and includes a dishwasher, double sink and large butler’s pantry.
The home is heated by the large wood heater and has a reverse cycle split system for the hot summer days.
Externally the property sits on approx 3.5 acres, landscaped ready to sit back and enjoy, or is ideal for horses or a hobby farmer. The Outdoor Alfresco at the rear of the house has a stone inbuilt BBQ, matching stone paving and runs the length of the home, ideal to host summer BBQs. The property has an elevated view of the Talbot Reservoir from the front entertaining area. Your water needs are met with 2 large water tanks and a high volume bore servicing all of the established gardens.
There is no shortage of shedding and storage which includes a double carport, a new 6 x 9 garage and a separate 9 x 4 shed, both with power and concrete floor. The property also has numerous smaller sheds, ideal for chooks, wood or gardening.
Well if that isn’t enough, this property also has a large salt water, solar heated in-ground swimming pool that will keep you entertained all summer long.
Situated only 36 mins to Ballarat and 22 mins to Maryborough, the property is within reach to all major amenities. School buses, both primary & secondary, Ballarat and Maryborough, service the area.
Please call to book your own private inspection. This property will not last.

Charming, Comfortable And Convenient With A 9 Acre Grazing License
Occupying a family friendly pocket of Creswick, this single level home offers exciting potential to further enhance or extend (STCA); with walking distance to Creswick Woollen Mills, Creswick North Primary School, a convenient bus stop and Flemos General Store.
Set on a sizeable allotment of approx 598m2, this three bedroom home is coupled with an expansive outdoor area with magnificent views, plus a grazing licence of approx 9 acres right around the corner.
Built through the 60s, yet boasting a number of upgrades over time; including a dramatic black and white bathroom with corner spa, a master room with mirrored robes and ceiling fan, two further bedrooms with polished timber floors and a cosy living/meals area with a split system and combustion wood heater.
There is a smart functional kitchen with ample storage and a new upright cooker, while the entire home has been freshly painted creating a light family home to begin your real estate journey.
To the rear there is a generous elevated deck, a handy garden shed and further area to protect a car or boat, while a lock up garage is attached to the home with easy access onto Williams Street.
Located on the high side of Creswick, this home is certainly worth your inspection.

Space Style and So Convenient
A wonderful opportunity for a range of buyers, this solid, dual level, double brick home has personality as well as complete flexibility.
Ready to begin a new chapter as a family home with a handy freestanding bungalow/studio to the rear, this home sits on a slightly sloping 1079m2; accessible to all your local needs including a short stroll to the bus stop, town centre and local milk bar.
Inside, polished ironbark floors guide you into a bright and spacious living room flanked by a dining zone and well-appointed kitchen with a central island bench and terrific storage options. The inviting floorplan delivers a home office or a second living zone, while accommodation includes a master suite with walk in robe and ensuite plus two or three further bedrooms sharing a bright main bathroom.
Downstairs provides a kitchen ,wood heating ,further room for storage or an additional rumpus room, with polished tiled flooring while stepping outdoors you will find a freestanding cedar cottage/studio; providing additional room for family members or those staying longer than overnight.
Extras include; a strategically placed split system in the lounge, gas central heating, ducted evaporative cooling , external sun blinds, two separate carports ,solar power (fed back to the grid)and amazing views from the back veranda.
This great property also has an adjacent annual crown lease of 0.1800 HA.

Designer Double Storey Home - Brand New, Ready To Move In!
This fabulous, modern two storey home is newly built by quality builders McMaster Homes & situated in beautiful Creswick.
Sitting on a generous allotment of approximately 624m2, this fully fenced corner block is highlighted by its prime location with walking distance to the Creswick North Primary school Flemos General Store along with various parks, reserves and public transport.
From its prized location through to its brand new designer details, this home with double auto garage with internal access boasts luxurious proportions and exceptional attention to detail. Eye-catching floating vinyl flooring stretches through the bright, open plan with a generous family dining room; complemented by a sublime kitchen boasting a stone island bench, black tapware, premium appliances, a large pantry and oodles of storage space.
Parents will value the grand views along with a walk-in robe and modern ensuite; whilst a teenager's retreat, a study nook and three additional double bedrooms with built-in robes are served by a stylish main bathroom.
Outdoor relaxation is enhanced by a low-maintenance backyard bathed in lashings of northerly light, overlooking an alfresco zone providing year-round enjoyment.
Finishing touches include zoned ducted heating/cooling, a powder room and European laundry is neatly tucked under the stairwell to free up the living zones.

Live The Lifestyle With Room To Move
Running from Hepburn Street right through to George Street, this massive rectangular allotment offers carefree gardens with fascinating views across to the beautiful historic bluestone building of Anderson's Flour Mill.
With several original outbuildings, this 1,977m2 slightly sloping allotment provides fence line gardens and trees, open spaces and enough room to add a further shed or even room for a large pet or two.
Anchored to the front of the allotment, there is a neat three-bedroom weatherboard home with a long side driveway to a shed which serves as a handy single car garage.
The kitchen/dining room is a great open plan to add a large island bench or uplift with some modern touches, while the living room boasts, timber floors, ceiling fan and an open fireplace: ideal for those cold wintery nights.
The family bathroom provides a bath and vanity with built in storage, while the shower is incorporated with the laundry also with built in storage.
This property would make a fabulous first home, or if you are a little more adventurous, even consider dividing the block with subdivision approval (STCA).
A great opportunity to enjoy a quiet country life in Smeaton, only ten minutes to Creswick and a short drive to Daylesford or Ballarat.

Amazing Acreage Opportunity in Allendale/Kingston.
Situated on the border of historic Kingston and only minutes from Creswick and 20 minutes to Daylesford and Ballarat is this stunning property on over 48 acres of land. Currently fenced into 2 paddocks with a dam to the back of the property and town water also connected, this is an ideal place to build your dream home and secure a future in this tightly held belt.
Planning Permits are in place and available for viewing to interested parties for a sensational 6 bedroom dwelling, significant shedding, a substantial olive grove and a further 2 dams, along with many other improvements.
Great acreage grass coverage for livestock and the ability to truly make your living from the land while enjoying the lifestyle and community that this amazing part of the Hepburn Shire has to offer.
Please contact the agent for further information and to view the supporting documentation.
GST may be applicable on the sale of farmland.

Ideal Residential Building Block in Central Creswick.
With its central location, just 400 Meters to the centre of town and views over Creswick Creek and parklands is this 422m2 building block with all services immediately available. Whether you are looking at building your dream home or wanting to take advantage of the burgeoning holiday & tourism rental market in Creswick, you will not find a better positioned parcel of land this close to everything.
First Home buyers can take advantage of the $20,000 regional first home buyers grant. Concept drawings are available on request.
Call the agent for more information.
*Central Creswick Location
*All Services available at front of block
* Parkland and walking trails at your doorstep
*Commanding position with stunning views

Apartment overlooking the RACV Goldfields Resort Golf Course
Overlooking the 9th hole of the renowned RACV Goldfields Resort in Creswick is this two-bedroom ground floor apartment, perfect for a weekend getaway, investment, Airbnb or home with some wonderful services nearby.
The resort is situated between Ballarat and Creswick, while Daylesford is a short car trip away. The apartment itself offers two generous bedrooms with built in robes and ensuite to master, the open plan kitchen offers a large bench top with ample storage, a living area with a great view of the garden and the golf course. There is also a main bathroom and separate laundry.
Outside you will find a private rear deck with a manicured garden while overlooking the 9th hole at the golf course, perfect for relaxing or entertaining guests.

Ideal Investment in Creswick
Just a leisurely stroll to the local shopping precinct and St Georges lake.
The original features of this home give character and charm. The astute purchaser will soon transform this property to a modern abode.
Generous sized living area, through to an open plan kitchen dining provides plenty of space for all home occupants.
Features Include: 3-bedrooms, natural gas heating in lounge, mains electric hot water, electric upright stove, plus separate shower & bath, are just some of the feature of this home.
The property offers ample off-street parking, with a tilt door double garage - space for vehicles and the home handy person, all on 557 sqm

Picturesque 20 Acres & Views Await Your Dream Home
This is a truly exciting opportunity to secure a wonderful parcel just on the outskirts of Creswick. It delivers on views from any home built on the allotment. Things to know:
- Elevated and clear block of 8.26ha (20.4acres).
- Corner allotment allows for fabulous access options for all types of vehicles
- Power runs along boundary.
- Option to increase grazing land by further 2 acres with extremely affordable verge license.
- Numerous flat building sites offer lovely district views.
- Large perennial dam and seasonal creek.
- Mature stand of beautiful pines anchors the land, creating a focal point and providing wind protection.
- Quiet country road, 5 minutes from hub of Creswick, 20 minutes from Ballarat.
- High quality bore water is available for domestic and stock. (no bore has been dug)
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Beautiful Piece of Land Awaits
Approximately 2 hours from central Melbourne, this 22-acre property is ideal for the hobby farmer or just a great place to get away from the rat race. Located less than 10 minutes from Maryborough & Clunes on the outskirts of Talbot, the gentle slope of the land ensures the dam gets plenty of water and takes full advantage of the lovely country views with the Pyrenees Ranges as a backdrop for the country estate to be built STCA.
Features include:
Sheep yards & load race
School bus passes by end of road
Zoned Rural Living
Views across the surrounding district
Large Dam
Mostly cleared pasture/grazing
Scatter gums at front of block

Location And Low Maintenance Living
In a position afforded to only a privileged few, this quiet court location sits just metres from the natural expanses of bushland, along with the convenience of walking distance to a bus stop and the heart of beautiful Creswick.
By today's standards, this elegant home is entirely comfortable with three sizeable bedrooms, a handy family bathroom, a separate toilet with hand basin, a generous laundry with storage and two lovely living zones with ducted heating and cooling. A further gas heater improves the comfort level, with external sun blinds adding protection to large bay window in the master suite.
Neatly presented, the expansive kitchen features stainless steel appliances and excellent storage with an open connection to the family area and casual dining space, while the formal lounge/dining is designed for nighttime relaxation.
Step outside to a trellis trimmed alfresco, extending through to the delightful rear yard that has many years of nurturing care. Hidden in the corner of the 539m2 allotment, there is a handy, tool shed, while the single lock up garage provides rear access and internal access to the home.
This good-looking property would ideal for retirees especially considering its location benefits, while the overall floorplan is also perfect for those starting out or investors.

Build your dream home or holiday!!
Phone enquiries - please quote property ID 21365
Situated in an ideal stroll to cafes and shops, the property has all services connected. Enjoy the beautiful view over the town with west facing, build your dream home or capitalise on the tourism potential with the new MTB park soon to be built and the pump track just down the hill.
There are 2 blocks available for sale:
1- @441sqm
2- @442sqm
Open for negotiation and can be purchased as a whole.
Also available nearby is a 3 bedroom home on a 637sqm block.
DISCLAIMER While proudly assisting home owners to sell since 1999, No Agent Property takes every care to verify the accuracy of the details in this advertisement, but the correctness cannot be guaranteed.

Country Living on Daylesfords Doorstep
A short drive through the Wombat State Forrest brings you to the small hamlet of Barkstead, just 10 minutes on the Melbourne side of Daylesford. This well-loved family home is neatly presented on approx. 1 acre of cleared land and has scope for renovation with plenty of space to grow your own food or plant an orchard and live a more sustainable lifestyle. The residence offers 3 good sized bedrooms with a central kitchen/dining and adjoining living room. Outside the gardens are established and a number of various sized sheds and carports offer plenty of storage solutions for cars, tools, caravan, horse float etc. A terrific opportunity just 20 minutes to Ballan and approx. 70 minutes to Melbourne.
- 4845m2 cleared land, adjoining the Wombat State Forest
- Mains power, bottled gas, rain water tanks, septic system
- Established gardens, enclosed fernery, fenced back yard
- Split system heating/cooling, wood fire place, gas heater
- Surrounded by State Forest offering a number of walking tracks for hiking, motorbike riding etc.
Inspections are available by private appointment and recommended.

Family Entertainer In Great location
This brick veneer family home delivers light soaked privacy and expansive spaces within manicured gardens on a generous corner allotment of approximately 776m2.
Built by Metricon, this four bedroom Creswick home truly embraces those who love to entertain with a formal lounge/dining to the front, an informal family/meals area and a fabulous L' shaped alfresco to continue your dining or entertaining outdoors
The kitchen is smartly designed with stainless steel appliances and a culinary lime green splash back with excellent storage and preparation space, while an independent study adds further room for children's study or working from home.
Beautifully presented with polished blackwood floors, this property is comforted by ducted central heating, evaporative cooling and a cosy wood heater while external sun blinds and solar energy provides renewable energy that will effectively reduce your running costs.
Enjoy the advantages of this corner allotment with side access to the rear yard, along with additional garden sheds, a water tank and a double lock up garage with internal and back yard access.
Situated just moments from the heart of the town and great access to the Midland Highway if commuting back to Ballarat or onto Melbourne.

Lifestyle and Location Ideal Building Block Approx 2868m2
This super sized corner allotment of approximately 2868m2 is ready and waiting for your dream home.
With a flat bitumen road frontage, power, water, gas and phone available, this exceptional slice of land provides the ideal proximity to many facilities and amenities.
Just moments from the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve, Creswick Primary School and of course all the delights for which Creswick is renowned for.
Call your architect today; as this allotment facing either Bald Hills Road or Armstrong street can handle almost anything!
Find out further details, by calling our office today.

Tranquil 3 Bedroom Country Living
Set on 2 hectares (5 acres) of lightly treed bush in the tranquil Wombat State Forest, this 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom family home enjoys a pleasing vista from every room, set against a backdrop of polished hardwood floors and abundant natural light from the full height windows.
Thoughtfully designed so that the bedrooms are separate from the living areas, the interior conveys a sense of warmth through the use of natural materials and a neutral colour scheme which cosily aligns with the natural bush setting.
Drawing on the Australian vernacular with a wrap around verandah, alfresco dining area and yes, even the ubiquitous pizza oven and fire pit, the list of improvements is extensive:
50,000 litre rain water storage
Shaded dam
2 car garage and work shed
Abundant native and deciduous trees and plants
Reticulated garden watering system
Polito pizza oven
Partial sealed road access
Wood heater and split system air con
Ensuite, walk-in robe, separate toilet and laundry
Abundant storage
Quietly secluded but far from isolated, Blampied is home to the Swiss Mountain Hotel, and Overwrought Sculpture Garden, with the Tuki Trout Farm in nearby Smeaton and Daylesford and Creswick are an easy 15 minute drive in either direction.
McQueen Broadhurst is taking important measures to mitigate the risk and further spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus). The health and wellbeing of our clients, the community and our team, is extremely important to us.
Please refrain from entering the property if you have:
recently returned from overseas in the past 14 days
are experiencing cold or flu like symptoms
had contact with someone suspected or confirmed with Coronavirus
We ask that you please:
use the sanitiser provided
refrain from touching furniture, fixtures, fittings and any surfaces
respect social distancing, keeping at least 1.5 metres from other people
Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.
*We have obtained all information in this document from sources we believe to be reliable, however, we cannot guarantee its accuracy. Prospective purchasers are advised to carry out their own investigations.

COUPLES OR SINGLES DELIGHT IN POPULAR TALBOT
Boasting impressive rural views this cozy home is situated on 4413m2 (approx.) or just over an acre on the edge of the lovely regional town of Talbot, famous for its Farmers Market. This one bedroom home is beautifully renovated with open plan living. The house yard is fully fenced and there is a separate paddock perfect for some animals. Enjoy a fresh modern kitchen with granite bench tops, generous storage & 2pac gloss finish. The stylish kitchen also comes fitted with near new appliances including electric cooking and dishwasher and room for the dining table. The open plan living room features a wood heater and split system catering to all your cooling and heating needs. The stunning near new bathroom comes with a large bath and separate over-sized shower overlooking rural views. Good sized laundry and study nook complete the interior of this home. In addition, a fully powered double garage allows plenty of room for a workshop and storage, a large water tank and undercover area at the back of the home. This large allotment allows for future development (STCA), home extension or perhaps a small hobby farm dream orchard or market garden. Inspection is a must, so call today!

ESCAPE TO THE COUNTRY
Approx 10 acres of land part cleared and part nature trees and scrub located only a short drive from Talbot and approx 20 klms from Maryborough. Power is located at the rear of the block. This property is an ideal country retreat suitable for holidays and weekends or as a future residential home site (STCA). Call for details
